intro.title: Comprehensive support for your most important decisions
intro.p1: Abogados Watson was born with the mission to transform the complexity of Spanish law into a secure and understandable transition. We specialize in technical immigration and international mobility, combining legal rigor with a special sensitivity towards those who decide to establish their future in Spain.
intro.p2: We believe that every person is unique, and so is their legal situation. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive service supported by a network of specialized collaborators to cover every need with technical solvency.

founder.title: The Founder
founder.name: Watson
founder.bio: Of international and multilingual origin, Watson brings a global vision indispensable in the mobility sector. After training in performing arts and music, she graduated in Law from the University of Valladolid and completed her Master's at the Camilo José Cela University. Her career in high-caliber multidisciplinary firms has allowed her to specialize in real estate contracting, successions, and technical immigration. Her organized and detailed vision is key to offering honest, responsible, and truly understandable legal advice.

regimes.title: General Regime vs. Community Regime
regimes.subtitle: It is essential to correctly identify the legal framework applicable to your family situation.

general.title: General Regime
general.subtitle: For Non-EU Residents
general.description: Applicable to foreigners with legal residence in Spain who wish to bring their family members. Requires having resided for at least 1 year (to reunify spouse and children) or being a long-term resident (for ascendants).
features: Family bond: Spouse, children under 18, and ascendants over 65.
Initial application in Spain by the reunifying party.

community.title: Community Regime
community.subtitle: Relatives of EU Citizens / Family Roots
community.description: For relatives of Spanish citizens or other EU States. Includes the EU Family Member Card and the new Family Roots for caregivers or children of Spanish nationals by origin.
features: Relatives: Spouse, registered partner, children under 21, and dependent ascendants.
Direct processing in Spain after the relative's entry.

requirements.title: Real Limits: Income and Housing
requirements.description: The administration applies strict mathematical criteria. The desire to be together is not enough; material capacity for support must be demonstrated.

income.title: Economic Income (IPREM)
income.description: General Regime: 150% of IPREM for the first relative (approx. €900) and 50% extra for each additional relative.

housing.title: Housing Adequacy
housing.description: It is mandatory to present an Adequate Housing Report issued by the Autonomous Community or City Council.

dependency.title: Economic Dependency
dependency.description: For ascendants, it must be proven that they live at the expense of the reunifying party through regular money transfers (generally last 12 months).

familyBond.title: Family Bond
familyBond.description: Marriage or birth certificates duly apostilled or legalized and translated.

means.title: Means of Support
means.description: Employment contract, pay stubs, and last Income Tax return (IRPF).

insurance.title: Health Insurance
insurance.description: In the community regime, it is vital to have private insurance without waiting periods or copays if not working.

info.title: Important Note:
info.description: Resolution deadlines vary according to the Immigration Office, but administrative silence is usually negative after 45-90 days. A perfect presentation reduces the risk of requirements that prolong the process.

retention.description: The personal data provided will be retained while the professional relationship is maintained or for the years necessary to comply with legal obligations (specifically 5 years in tax and commercial matters, and up to 10 years in anti-money laundering prevention).

rights.title: 5. Your Rights
rights.description: As the data subject, you may exercise at any time your rights to:
items: Access to your personal data.
Rectification of inaccurate data.
Erasure (right to be forgotten).
Limitation of processing.
Objection to processing.
Data portability.
rights.exercise: To exercise these rights, you can send an email to legal@abogadoswatson.com, attaching a copy of your ID or equivalent document to verify your identity.

CookiesPage.title: Cookie Policy
CookiesPage.intro: This website uses cookies to improve user experience and analyze navigation traffic. In compliance with LSSI-CE, we inform you about what they are and how we manage them.

what.title: What is a cookie?
what.description: A cookie is a small text file that is downloaded to your browser when you access certain web pages. It allows the website to store and retrieve information about your browsing habits or your device.

technical.title: 1. Technical Cookies
technical.description: Necessary for the proper functioning of the site, such as session management or language selection.

analytical.title: 2. Analytical Cookies
analytical.description: They allow us to quantify the number of users and perform measurement and statistical analysis of how users use the service offered.

management.title: Cookie Management
management.description: You can allow, block, or delete cookies installed on your device through the settings of the browser installed on your computer:

browsers.firefoxValue: Settings - Privacy and security - Cookies and site data.
